settings.title: December 2024 Kiln Load
settings.text:
This month's firing was particularly successful! I loaded the kiln with 58 pieces, including several new glaze experiments that turned out beautifully.

Featured in this load are sage green mugs, speckled bowls, and a limited series of vases with my new copper-fleck glaze. Each piece is one-of-a-kind and ready to ship.

settings.title: About This Firing
settings.text:
This kiln load was fired to cone 6 (approximately 2232Â°F) over a 12-hour period. The slow cooling cycle took another 24 hours, allowing the glazes to develop their full depth and character.

I tested three new glaze combinations in this firing, and I'm excited to share the results with you. The copper-fleck glaze creates beautiful metallic highlights that catch the light differently throughout the day.

settings.title: Next Kiln Load
settings.text:
I'm already preparing for January's firing! I have several custom orders in progress, plus new experiments with a deep forest green glaze.

Subscribe to my newsletter to get notified when the next kiln load is ready. You'll be the first to see new pieces and get early access to limited pieces.
